revised_title: Long-Period Motion of Distant Circular Orbits
tldr: The authors study the long-period motion of the plane of a distant circular orbit, considering Earth satellites in regions where the perturbing effects due to Earth's oblateness and luni-solar forces are comparable. They provide a general solution for simultaneous precession about any number of fixed axes and discuss the motion of Earth satellites at distances of a few Earth radii, which is of interest for communication satellites.
